ARABIC: أَوْ زِدْ عَلَيْهِ وَرَتِّلِ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ تَرْتِيلًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: or a little more, and recite the Qur'an distinctly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Or a little more, and recite the Qur'an slowly and distinctly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: or add to it a little; and recite the Qur'an slowly and distinctly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and recite the Quran in a distinct tone;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Or increase a little upon it, and recite the Qur’an slowly in stages.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Or a little more. And Rattil the Qur'an Tartil.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Or add to it, and recite the Quran as it ought to be recited.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: or add a little), and chant the Koran very distinctly;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Or add (a little) thereto - and chant the Qur'an in measure,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: or a little more, but recite the Quran slowly and distinctly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Or increase thereto. And intone the Qur'an with a measured intontion. s
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: or add to it, and recite the Quran in a measured tone.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Or a little more; and recite the Qur'an in slow, measured rhythmic tones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Or a little more; and recite the Quran (aloud) in a slow, (pleasant tone and) style.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: or a little more; and with recitation, recite the Koran.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Or add to it; and chant the Quran rhythmically.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Or add to it, and recite the Qur'an with measured recitation.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [73:4]   or add to it, up to two thirds (aw implies [free] choice), and recite the Qur’ān, recite it carefully, in a measured tone.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Or add (a little) thereto) or pray more than half of the night, up to two thirds of the night, thus giving him a choice, and then He said: (and chant the Qur'an in measure) recite the Qur'an deliberately, unhurriedly and with gravity, i.e. reciting two or three verses each time until you finish the whole recitation,
